headline: Mathetic Questions
description: Sixteen open-ended questions for learners. This post flips the traditional test format into a curiosity engine — blending humor, reflection, and informal truth-seeking.
resonantThread: how we learn by reflecting on how we learn
whyItMatters: These questions resist the standardization of the learner. They ask not for answers, but for presence. A small, funny, sincere invitation into what makes someone become a student of the world.
sourceFragments: How do you take ownership of your own learning?
Star Wars or Star Trek or Dune and why?
Would you rather… take mushrooms and go to the planetarium?
What is one thing all teachers could do, to improve learning for all?
